Description: Shoe for the left foot of a child, made of leather, with rounded toe, complete with sole and upper, stitched together, flattened and cracked at heel, upper bound at top.
Curator's comments: Veldmeijer, Studies of Ancient Egyptian Footwear. Technological Aspects. Part XVII. Leather Stubbed-Toe Ankle Shoes. Jaarbericht “ex oriente lux” 44, (2012-2013), pp. 4, 14, 16.
